title: Donald Trump describes Harris as 'bad combination' of 'vicious and dumb'
content: Donald Trump has branded Vice President Kamala Harris as 'vicious and dumb' in an interview with The Post, marking his first major comments since President Biden withdrew from the presidential race. Trump’s remarks come as Harris, the likely Democratic nominee, seeks to consolidate support. Trump’s criticisms include past controversies and Harris’s role as Biden’s 'border czar.'
summary: Donald Trump has branded Vice President Kamala Harris as 'vicious and dumb' in an interview with The Post, marking his first major comments since President Biden withdrew from the presidential race. Trump’s remarks come as Harris, the likely Democratic nominee, seeks to consolidate support. Trump’s criticisms include past controversies and Harris’s role as Biden’s 'border czar.'

title: Israeli government quietly sends millions to unauthorized West Bank settler outposts
content: Documents uncovered by Peace Now illustrate how Israel's pro-settler government has quietly poured money into the unauthorized outposts, which are separate from its more than 100 officially recognized settlements. Some of those outposts have been linked to settler violence against Palestinians and are sanctioned by the US.
summary: Documents uncovered by Peace Now illustrate how Israel's pro-settler government has quietly poured money into the unauthorized outposts, which are separate from its more than 100 officially recognized settlements. Some of those outposts have been linked to settler violence against Palestinians and are sanctioned by the US.

title: Thousands of migrant kids have reached the Canary Islands alone
content: Mora Peces is among a growing number of people sounding the alarm as the archipelago struggles to deal with thousands of teenagers and children traveling alone to the European Union territory from Senegal, Mali, and other African nations, fleeing poverty, conflict and instability.
summary: Mora Peces is among a growing number of people sounding the alarm as the archipelago struggles to deal with thousands of teenagers and children traveling alone to the European Union territory from Senegal, Mali, and other African nations, fleeing poverty, conflict and instability.

title: Israeli operation in Gaza's Khan Yunis kills 70
content: The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza said Monday that an Israeli operation in the main southern city of Khan Yunis killed 70 people and wounded more than 200, after Israel warned its forces would "forcefully operate" in the area. "Due to the Israeli occupation's attacks and massacres in Khan Yunis governorate from the early hours of this morning until now, 70 people have been martyred and more than 200 wounded," the Gaza health ministry said.
summary: The health ministry in Hamas-run Gaza said Monday that an Israeli operation in the main southern city of Khan Yunis killed 70 people and wounded more than 200, after Israel warned its forces would "forcefully operate" in the area. "Due to the Israeli occupation's attacks and massacres in Khan Yunis governorate from the early hours of this morning until now, 70 people have been martyred and more than 200 wounded," the Gaza health ministry said.

title: Hindu temple in Canada defaced with anti-India graffiti
Watch: Woman calls 911 to report suspected intruder, 'shot in face' by Illinois police
content: Bodycam footage released by Illinois police shows the fatal shooting of Sonya Massey by a sheriff's deputy. The officer has been charged with murder and official misconduct, pleading not guilty. President Biden expresses condolences, while protests demand justice. The incident highlights ongoing issues of police violence and the need for reform.
summary: Bodycam footage released by Illinois police shows the fatal shooting of Sonya Massey by a sheriff's deputy. The officer has been charged with murder and official misconduct, pleading not guilty. President Biden expresses condolences, while protests demand justice. The incident highlights ongoing issues of police violence and the need for reform.

title: Taiwan curtails annual war games as Typhoon Gaemi barrels towards island
content: Gaemi, the first typhoon of the season to affect Taiwan, is expected to make landfall on the northeast coast between sometime on Wednesday night and the early hours of Thursday, according to the island's Central Weather Administration.
summary: Gaemi, the first typhoon of the season to affect Taiwan, is expected to make landfall on the northeast coast between sometime on Wednesday night and the early hours of Thursday, according to the island's Central Weather Administration.

title: Astrophotographer captures stunning 236,000-mile-long solar wall of plasma
'I look forward to ...': Harris secured broad support needed to become party's nominee
What’s the buzz about Kamala Harris' 'coconut tree' meme?
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris, a frontrunner for the Democratic presidential nomination, has gained momentum thanks to viral 'coconut tree' memes. These memes, originating from a May 2023 speech, have turned Harris’s quirky remarks into a social media sensation. With President Biden out, Harris's candidacy has surged, bolstered by memes, celebrity endorsements, and digital campaigns.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris, a frontrunner for the Democratic presidential nomination, has gained momentum thanks to viral 'coconut tree' memes. These memes, originating from a May 2023 speech, have turned Harris’s quirky remarks into a social media sensation. With President Biden out, Harris's candidacy has surged, bolstered by memes, celebrity endorsements, and digital campaigns.

title: Biden set to return to White House on Tuesday, expected to meet Netanyahu: Official
Julian Assange's post-prison life: WikiLeaks founder reappears in smiling beachside family photo
Conservatives to announce new leader on November 2 after historic defeat
content: Britain's Conservative party will announce its new leader on November 2, following former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's resignation after a historic electoral defeat. The party's worst-ever result, with only 121 MPs, saw Labour achieve a 174-seat majority. Potential successors include Kemi Badenoch and Suella Braverman. The leadership race will culminate in an online vote in October.
summary: Britain's Conservative party will announce its new leader on November 2, following former Prime Minister Rishi Sunak's resignation after a historic electoral defeat. The party's worst-ever result, with only 121 MPs, saw Labour achieve a 174-seat majority. Potential successors include Kemi Badenoch and Suella Braverman. The leadership race will culminate in an online vote in October.

title: All but one airline still recovering from CrowdStrike tech outage
content: Delta Air Lines is still grappling with a tech outage, leading to thousands of flight cancellations. The slow recovery process contrasts with other airlines nearing normal operations. Transportation Secretary in contact with Delta over complaints. Passengers facing delays and uncertainties. Delta's systems heavily impacted by the outage.
summary: Delta Air Lines is still grappling with a tech outage, leading to thousands of flight cancellations. The slow recovery process contrasts with other airlines nearing normal operations. Transportation Secretary in contact with Delta over complaints. Passengers facing delays and uncertainties. Delta's systems heavily impacted by the outage.

title: Harris gains momentum, secures majority of delegates she needed for nomination
Americans face deluge of trash talk and conspiracy theories in election season
Musk and Khosla argue over Trump's GOP candidature
'I know Trump's type': Harris calls Trump a 'predator and cheater,' pledges November victory
content: US Vice President Kamala Harris started her campaign with an attack on Donald Trump and a vow to win in November, following President Joe Biden's unexpected withdrawal. Harris, now the frontrunner for the Democratic nomination, emphasised her prosecutorial experience and commitment to key issues like abortion, while Biden endorsed her and praised her leadership.
summary: US Vice President Kamala Harris started her campaign with an attack on Donald Trump and a vow to win in November, following President Joe Biden's unexpected withdrawal. Harris, now the frontrunner for the Democratic nomination, emphasised her prosecutorial experience and commitment to key issues like abortion, while Biden endorsed her and praised her leadership.

title: 'I'm not going anywhere': Biden pledges campaign support for Harris after stepping down from 2024 race
